featured.text: Dioxin travels by air currents and settles onto grass, which is then eaten by cows and chickens in their feed.
The EPA estimates that the average levels of dioxin in all Americans are so high that we can expect to see a variety of health effects, including cancer.
We eat polluted dairy products and meat and take the dioxin into our bodies, where it is stored in our fat for years and builds up over time.
Dioxin is an unwanted byproduct that is created when PVC is burned.
This poses special problems for childbearing women, who pass dioxin to an unborn baby or to a breastfeeding baby.

other.text: In this way, dioxin is globally distributed, and as a consequence, every member of the human population is constantly exposed to this poisonous substance.
What does it in the last line refer to? (A) Dioxin.
Using reusables as people did in the old days will help lessen dioxin pollution.
Linked to the dioxin issue is the use of PVC plastic, which is widely used in the production of blood bags, plastic tubing, and other products in hospitals and health clinics.
We had better not breastfeed our babies, since babies are most likely to be poisoned by dioxin.

definition.zh_def: 二噁英是一種有毒的化合物，通常由工業過程或燃燒產生，對環境和健康有害。
definition.en_def: Dioxin is a toxic compound often produced by industrial processes or combustion, harmful to the environment and health.
definition.example: Exposure to dioxin can lead to serious health issues.
